result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd H. Edgar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Todd H. Edgar

defendant.name: Edgar, Todd H.
defendant.address: 808 S. Wisconsin Ave. Apt.1, Rice Lake, WI 54868

records.addlTxt: Defendant Todd H. Edgar in court.  Attorney Ryan Kieler in court for Todd H. Edgar.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. State moves to amend charges to misdemeanor bail jumping with 2 years probation, no contact with victim, not to be within 1000 feet of victim's residence or one block of her vehicle, no contact with victim's children, counseling, psych evaluation, take prescribed medications, costs. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Court grants amendments. Defendant pleads no contest. Court accepts pleas and finds defendant guilty of both counts. Victim heard. State heard. Attorney Kieler heard. Court orders 90 days jail with work release and transfer to Barron County, consecutive, imposed and stayed, 2 years probation with conditions: Defendant shall not have any contact with victim by any means; defendant shall not post any electronic media or social media about or to victim or victim's family; not to be in visual contact of victim; not to be within 1000 feet of victim's residence; not to be within one block of victim's vehicle; not to reside in Fennimore or within three miles of Fennimore; no contact with victim's children; defendant shall not be on premises of Kwik Trip, Decker Drive, Rice Lake. Costs remitted on all counts.

Defendant Todd H. Edgar appeared by video, in custody at Grant County Jail.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Court explains charges, penalties, and right to counsel. Attorney Kieler is appointed in his other pending case. State requests a signature bond with the following condition: defendant shall not have any contact with Victim #1 or to be within 1000 ft (3 1/2 to 4 blocks) of her or her residence and shall not be within one block of her while in a vehicle. Court heard and orders $1000 signature bond with the condition defendant shall not have any contact with Victim #1 or to be within 1000 ft (3 1/2 to 4 blocks) of her or her residence and shall not be within one block of her while in a vehicle.
